meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! Gather 'round, because I'm about to spill the beans on Cryptmaster, an indie game that's got everyone in a tizzy!

As I delved into this mystical realm, I couldn't help but notice the Critics' Circle doing its thing. Slant Magazine gave it a 50, saying it was "frustrating as all get out" (I'm paraphrasing, of course), but praising those real-time typing mechanics and the visuals that look like they were plucked straight from a vintage wireframe game. Ah, yes, those critics who love to hate... or is it hate to love?

Meanwhile, Hardcore Gamer came along with an 80, giving props to Cryptmaster's originality in gameplay and narrative. They said it's got engaging side characters, an entertaining plot, and clever language-based mechanics that'll keep you hooked! Oh, and the game might be a bit wonky in terms of control responsiveness and visibility, but hey, who doesn't love a good challenge?

RPG Fan popped by with an 85, saying Cryptmaster does what it sets out to do, which is basically making you think really hard about words (in a good way, folks!). They mentioned the game's ability to keep things fresh with its ever-changing gameplay, and how vocabulary-based it all is! I mean, if you're into words, this game's got your name on it!

Sofpedia chimed in with an 85 of their own, praising Cryptmaster's world-building (because who doesn't love a good story?) and presentation (all that striking black-and-white business). They did say the combat can feel like a chore sometimes, but hey, at least there are those delightful bug sounds to listen for!

Last but not least, Movies Games and Tech came along with a 60, saying Cryptmaster's unique, don't get 'em wrong! However, if you're looking for a breathtaking story with good pacing... well, you might want to look elsewhere. Oh, and Press Start Australia? They gave it a 90, calling it a "wickedly clever spin on edutainment games" that combines typing with an underworld full of gallows humor and eccentrics! Spread the word, folks – this game's got some serious cred!

So there you have it, folks – my take on Cryptmaster. It's a wild ride, but don't worry if you get lost along the way. The real-time typing can be frustrating at times (see: Slant Magazine), but hey, that's just part of the adventure! And who knows? You might just find yourself falling in love with those words...
